title: US Coast Guard chases third oil ship near Venezuela
snippets: The US is pursuing a third oil tanker in international waters off the coast of Venezuela.
US coastguard 'in active pursuit' of a dark fleet vessel trying to evade sanctions on Venezuela, an official says.
The US considered the pursued vessel to be part of "Venezuela's illegal sanctions evasion," according to media reports. A US official reportedly said the vessel was flying a false flag.
The move comes days after President Donald Trump said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

U.S. forces have already intercepted two other tankers in waters off Venezuela this month as part of an effort to heighten pressure on President Nicolás Maduro.
The latest vessel to be targeted by the United States in its pressure campaign on Venezuela was sending distress signals as it headed northeast from the Caribbean into the Atlantic.
The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker accused of helping Venezuela evade U.S. sanctions, as pressure mounts on vessels tied to its shadow fleet.

summary: The U.S. Coast Guard is actively pursuing a third oil tanker in international waters off the coast of Venezuela, accusing it of helping Venezuela evade U.S. sanctions by operating as part of a "dark fleet" and flying a false flag. This follows the interception of two other sanctioned tankers earlier in the month, as part of a broader U.S. effort to increase pressure on President Nicolás Maduro's government. The latest vessel was reportedly sending distress signals as it moved northeast from the Caribbean.

Watch as the Pittsburgh Steelers hang on to defeat the Detroit Lions in a thriller, after Jared Goff’s fumble recovery TD is wiped off the board with no time remaining due to an offensive PI call on Amon Ra St. Brown.

The Pittsburgh Steelers pushed the Detroit Lions to the brink of elimination from the playoffs on Sunday, holding on for a 29-24 win when Jared Goff’s touchdown on the final play was negated by an offensive pass-interference penalty on Amon-Ra St. Brown.

title: Edmonton Oilers and other teams win close hockey games
snippets: McDavid scores again, Oilers hold off Golden Knights NHL.com
Ryan Nugent-Hopkins had two goals and three points on the night, Connor McDavid scored an impressive goal to go with his two assists, and the Edmonton Oilers handled the Vegas Golden Knights 4-3.
Karel Vejmelka made 23 saves and Clayton Keller had two points, including the overtime winning goal to lift the Utah Mammoth past the Winnipeg Jets 4-3.
Ukko-Pekka Luukkonen made 24 saves on the night, Zach Benson scored the eventual game-winner, and the Buffalo Sabres took care of the New Jersey Devils 3-1.
Moritz Seider scored the game-winning goal in overtime and Andrew Copp tallied two assists to help the Detroit Red Wings secure a 3-2 win against the Washington Capitals.
Jamie Benn had a goal and an assist, Sam Steel scored the game-winning goal and Jake Oettinger made 27 saves to help the Dallas Stars beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-1.
Fabian Zetterlund had a pair of goals and an assist, while Dylan Cozens and Drake Batherson each had three points to lift the Ottawa Senators past the Boston Bruins 6-2.
Nathan MacKinnon scored a pair of goals while Cale Makar recorded three points as the Colorado Avalanche defeated the Minnesota Wild 5-1.
Filip Forsberg scored his 16th goal of the season, Ryan O’Reilly added two assists to his season tally, and the Nashville Predators earned a 2-1 win over the New York Rangers.
titles: McDavid scores again, Oilers hold off Golden Knights - NHL.com
